metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1924 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
DOS / potential heap overwrite in mkv demuxing using lzo decompression.Integer overflow in matroskademux element in lzo decompression functionwhich causes a segfault, or could cause a heap overwrite, depending on libcand OS. Depending on the libc used, and the underlying OS capabilities, itcould be just a segfault or a heap overwrite. If the libc uses mmap forlarge chunks, and the OS supports mmap, then it is just a segfault (becausethe realloc before the integer overflow will use mremap to reduce the sizeof the chunk, and it will start to write to unmapped memory). However, ifusing a libc implementation that does not use mmap, or if the OS does notsupport mmap while using libc, then this could result in a heap overwrite.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer1.0-gtk3 - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-plugins-good - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-pulseaudio - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1
gstreamer1.0-qt5 - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1
libgstreamer-plugins-good1.0-0 - 1.20.3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-good1.0 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.20.3-0ubuntu1').
